events.name: IoT with Talend- Integrating Real-Time Data Streams with Spark and Kafka
events.description: Integrating Real-Time Data Streams with Spark and Kafka for data-driven organization  Join Talend as they bring you a deep, technical discussion on the real-world data science that underlies modern data-driven organization. Working from IOT real time-streaming data, and using tools that you can use yourself, Talend will walk through the process of building an analytics package, using Spark and Kafka to collect real-time instrumentation data and produce meaningful results in minutes. **************************************************** There will be some prizes to be won during QnA!! **************************************************** Speaker’s bio:  SengJoo Lim A Solutions Engineer at Talend, SengJoo brings over 16 years of diverse experience in pre/post sales solution architecting, customer/partners engagement, programme/project management and service delivery with specialization in new business demand creation especially cloud adoption, various technology consultation, programme development, project implementation and operation management. SengJoo has extensive knowledge on Data Integration, Application Integration, Data Quality, Cloud Integration and of course Big Data Integration. Follow Talend: Talend User Group in Singapore LinkedIn Facebook Twitter  ************************************************************  DATE & AGENDA: Thursday, 6th April 2017 • 06:00 pm – Registration & Networking over snacks (sponsored by Talend) • 06:50 pm – Introduction by CK  • 07:00 pm – Talk & Demo by SengJoo • 08:15 pm –  QnA  • 08:30 pm - Networking continued ************************************************************  VENUE: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #02-01, SG139951 ************************************************************  Note: Please note that photography and videography will be carried out throughout the event.  IoT SG, Event Sponsors, Supporters may use some or all of these images in its print publications, digital, social platforms and/or marketing channels. We also ask some personal information and questions during registration. This data is used to do further due diligence to improve the quality of events. This data may also be shared with sponsoring organisations, speakers to help them to collaborate more efficiently. We do not sell your data.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: [Agile Singapore] Yow! night - Move faster (free)
events.description: This may be of interest to people of this group: Please use eventbrite to reserve ticket - https://www.eventbrite.com.au/e/yow-night-2017-singapore-fred-george-apr-6-tickets-32944458763. identify three categories of inhibitors, and suggest mitigation strategies I have employed for each one: • Technology inhibitors, whether dealing with legacy languages, tools, or architectures, • Process inhibitors, particularly daunting as shifts to faster processes run counter to the “tried and true” processes inherent in the organization, and • Organization inhibitors as we shake off the time­consuming waterfall structures.
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore

events.name: An Evening With Techstars Accelerator + APAC Team!
events.description:
RSVP for free here: bit.ly/techstarssg

Speakers:
Terry Gold (Managing Director, Techstars Adelaide)
Jennifer Cabala (VP of Startup Programs, Techstars)
Lalitha Wemel (Regional Manager, Asia Pacific, Techstars)
Oko Davaasuren (Director APAC, Startup Programs, Techstars)

Agenda
- 6:30 PM - Welcome Drinks and Arrival
- 7:00 PM - Introduction to the Techstars Adelaide Accelerator - What Startups Need to Know w/ Terry Gold 
- 7:30 PM - Introduction to Techstars Startup Programs Chat w/ Jennifer Cabala
- 8.00 PM - Q&A + Open Discussion + Networking 

Techstars Adelaide is our first APAC-based accelerator in Australia. The program supports startups advancing innovative applications in IoT, big data, sensors and robotics, with potential to develop and commercialize technologies connected to the defence and security sectors. Defence research has driven some of the most transformative consumer innovation in the world including the internet and GPS. Adelaide is a tech-forward city that is building sophisticated infrastructure for startups.

The accelerator will run in Adelaide, Australia and kicks off in July 2017. During the 3-month intensive program, participants will receive intense mentoring and guidance from key industry experts, and Techstars’ global network of more than 7,000 founders, mentors, investors, and corporate partners. Each company participating in the program receives $20,000 in funding upon acceptance, and access to an additional $100,000 convertible debt note at their sole option.

This info session will be an informal discussion about Techstars, defence innovation, as well as Techstars Startup Programs in Asia Pacific, and hopefully answer any and all questions you may have about this amazing opportunity. Join us!

Get more application info on the Techstars Adelaide Accelerator, and apply at: https://apply.techstars.com/ + find out more about Startup Weekend at https://startupweekend.org

Joining the team will be Oko Davaasuren and Lalitha Wemel from the Asia Pacific Techstars Startup Programs team.
events.location: Collision 8, 1 North Bridge Road High Street Centre, #08-08, Singapore 179094

events.name: Path Planning: DESPOT – the best POMDP Solver yet?
events.description: Zhan Wei contributed to building one of the best Partially-observable Markov Decision Process (POMDP) Solvers in the world, DESPOT. Solving the POMDP problem is one of the key opportunity areas for self-driving cars, in decision-making and path planning. One major obstacle for robotics practitioners in adopting POMDP is that most practical problems get complex very quickly when you describe it in POMDP and end up becoming intractable. DESPOT overcomes a number of these issues using Monte-carlo simulations and sampling. Zhan Wei did his PhD at NUS on algorithms for planning under uncertainty, which is essential to robots that need to make decisions in the real world. He was involved with the software development of APPL, the offline POMDP solver and more recently DESPOT, the online POMDP solver. Dr Lim Zhan Wei is now an engineer at Movel AI, a startup from Entrepreneur First.
